intro: Mentha canadensis, commonly known as Canada mint, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm, with opposite, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its fragrant, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late summer. Canada mint is widely used in herbal medicine for its cooling properties and as a natural remedy for digestive issues.
